Badminton Rules • A game can take place with either 2 (singles) or 4 (doubles) players. • An official match has to be played indoors on the proper court dimensions. The dimensions are 6.1m by 13.4m, The net is situated throught the middle of the court and is set at 1.55m • To score a point the birdie must hit within the guidelines of the opponents court. • If the birdie hits the net or lands out then a point is awarded to your opponent • Players must serve diagonally across the net to their opponent. As points are won then serving stations move from one side to the other. There are no second serves so if your first serve goes out then your opponent wins the point. • A serve must be hit underarm and below the servers waist. No overarm serves allowed. • Each game will start with a toss to determine which player will serve first and which side of the court the opponent would like to start from. • A point is scored when you successfully hit the birdie over the net and land it in your opponent\'s court before they hit it. • A point can also be gained when your opponent hits the birdie into either the net or outside the guidelines. • To win a game you must reach 21 point before your opponent.

At that time, there were only a few senior high school players that were playing badminton competitively. and there was no badminton summer program. By the end of 2012 the club have 80 players and had introduced a badminton summer camp with 40 players attend the 1st summer camp.

One of our players in grade 9 won the High School City Championship and was also the SWOSSAA champion in boy\'s singles, In the Grade School district championships our players won the Boy\'s and Girls Singles titles.
